title: PGI 18.10 unable to compile some programs within spack
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

I installed PGI 18.10 community version, by creating a local mirror and by adding to it the package downloaded from https://www.pgroup.com/support/download_community.php?file=pgi-community-linux-x64 with md5 `0e1598c05aa8faeb84e351c0f68274c3`.

If I install a OpenMPI 3.x it breaks with the following error:
```console
$ spack spec -Il openmpi%pgi ^hwloc/hx5frro
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   openmpi%pgi
[+]      ^hwloc@1.11.11%pgi@18.10 cflags="-O2 -tp=haswell,skylake" cxxflags="-O2 -tp=haswell,skylake" fflags="-O2 -tp=haswell,skylake" ~cairo~cuda~gl+libxml2~nvml+pci+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]          ^libpciaccess@0.14%gcc@4.8.5 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2"  arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]          ^libxml2@2.9.8%gcc@8.2.0 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2" ~python arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]              ^libiconv@1.15%gcc@8.2.0 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2"  arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]              ^xz@5.2.2%gcc@4.8.5 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2"  arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]              ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@8.2.0 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2" +optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]          ^numactl@2.0.9%gcc@4.8.5 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2"  arch=linux-centos7-x86_64

Concretized
--------------------------------
 -   6o5suad  openmpi@3.1.3%pgi@18.10 cflags="-O2 -tp=haswell,skylake" cxxflags="-O2 -tp=haswell,skylake" fflags="-O2 -tp=haswell,skylake" ~cuda+cxx_exceptions fabrics=auto ~java~legacylaunchers~memchecker~pmi schedulers=auto ~sqlite3~thread_multiple+vt arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]  hx5frro      ^hwloc@1.11.11%pgi@18.10 cflags="-O2 -tp=haswell,skylake" cxxflags="-O2 -tp=haswell,skylake" fflags="-O2 -tp=haswell,skylake" ~cairo~cuda~gl+libxml2~nvml+pci+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]  oynyfyd          ^libpciaccess@0.14%gcc@4.8.5 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2"  arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]  hn3qdkl          ^libxml2@2.9.8%gcc@8.2.0 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2" ~python arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]  mlpop44              ^libiconv@1.15%gcc@8.2.0 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2"  arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]  tj3rw2q              ^xz@5.2.2%gcc@4.8.5 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2"  arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]  zgpsjkh              ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@8.2.0 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2" +optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
[+]  qpb6oct          ^numactl@2.0.9%gcc@4.8.5 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2"  arch=linux-centos7-x86_64
```

```console
$ spack install -v openmpi%pgi ^hwloc/hx5frro
...

    'make' '-j20'

```

If I compile the same OpenMPI version with pgi loaded from the module, and with the same configure line, it compiles smoothly.
OpenMPI 2.x compiles successfully.


The same happens with all versions of CDO, down to the 1.8.2:
```console
# spack spec -Il cdo@1.8.2%pgi grib2=grib-api  ^openmpi@2.1.6 ^fftw simd=avx,sse2 +openmp ^libxml2/hn3qdkl ^cmake/6yfnsdb
Input spec
--------------------------------
 -   cdo@1.8.2%pgi grib2=grib-api
[+]      ^cmake@3.13.3%gcc@8.2.0 cflags="-O2" cxxflags="-O2" fflags="-O2" ~doc+ncurses+openssl~ownlibs patches=93488edf3f89cef6f3c77e821007c022e88e9f1f566ae9bf824a87ecbac97ebb ~qt arch=linux
-centos7-x86_64
```

CDO compiles fine with GCC 8.2.0 using the same (most PGI) dependencies.

```commandline
CentOS Linux release 7.6.1810 (Core)
```
